link.script: window.setTimeout(function () { document.title = "Home - Coosa County School District"; }, 500);

div.div: Due to the effects of covid-19 in our county, Coosa County School System will suspend all school activities including food and work distribution until at least May 4th.
Coosa County Schools will be offering non-traditional instruction from April 6, 2020 through May 21, 2020 due to the mandates from the Alabama State Department of Education.

p.span: The Coosa County Board of Education will hold a regular meeting on

Pursuant to Governor Iveyâs emergency Proclamations of March 18, 2020, and April 2, 2020, this meeting will be held via Google Meet teleconference.Â To access the meeting dial 1-385-645-8109 and use PIN 754 309 279#.Â
A summary of the meeting can be found here.

span.span: Due to the effects of covid-19 in our county, Coosa County School System will suspend all school activities including food and work distribution until at least May 4th. Thank you for your cooperation this week in our efforts to distribute food and work. We had a successful week but at this time we feel the risk to our students and families and staff is great to continue. We will keep everyone updated through phone call outs with any changes. Please take every precaution to keep your family and everyone around you safe

p.span: Central High School Counselor, Mrs. Wade, has created a Google Classroom for the purpose of disseminating information to students and parents regarding registration for next year's courses.Â A registration form will be posted in theÂ classroom as an assignment for the students to complete.Â Please ensure that your student joins the Google Classroom Central High School Class of _______________ with the code____________.
11th grade Central High School Class of 2021Â Code: jvwvnal
10th grade Central High School Class of 2022 Code: ljnfmmv
9th grade Central High School Class of 2023 Code: 7ils2pd
8th grade Central High School Class of 2024 Code: yahx27h
7th grade Central High School Class of 2025 Code: ldoojeq
6th grade Central High School Class of 2026 Code: u2ohwws

div.h3: Click the link below to download a copy of the Superintendent's message

span.span: Coosa County Schools will be offering non-traditional instruction from April 6, 2020 through May 21, 2020 due to the mandates from the Alabama State Department of Education.Â Instructional material packets will be provided to the students each Monday Â beginning April 6, 2020 at designated locations.Â See below for drop-off locations/times.Â Teachers will provide instructions for completed assignments to be returned virtually, photocopy via email, REMIND, Google Classroom, etc.

em.span: Please continue to visit our county website coosaschools.k12.al.us and facebook page for the most up-to-date information.

br.span: Teachers will provide an online presence to help students with assignments.Â Contact your childâs teacher by email.Â You can search for a staff memberâs email by visiting the school website ces.coosaschools.k12.al.us or chs.coosaschools.k12.al.us and click on staff directory.

Technology resources can be found by going to coosaschools.k12.al.us and visiting the Technology Page.Â If you have a question about user names, passwords, or general technology use please use the form provided on the site to reach out to the district.Â

em.span: If unable to reach help by using the above website please contact Central Office 256-377-4913 ext 2030.

br.span: All games, practices, and athletic events have been canceled through the end of the school year.
All school-related field trips and extracurricular activities have been canceled through the end of the school year.
School nurses will not be in the office during this time.Â Contact Celeste Thornton via email
to arrange pick up of medications.Â Medication pick up requires parent signature.
Practice activities will be sent home to students and the therapist will follow up with families.
Speech and language practice activities will be sent home to students and the therapist will follow up with families.

Lunch and a snack will be delivered on Mondays and Thursdays beginning April 6, 2020.Â Buses will depart from schools at 12:00 noon for drop-off locations.Â See back for drop-off locations/times.Â Edâs Deli in Goodwater and Triple R CafÃ© in Rockford will continue to provide lunches from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays.Â
If your student has been receiving services from AltaPointe at school, please contact AltaPointe for assistance 256-245-2201.
Direct questions to CHS counselor Misty Wade via email
CHS students may visit chscougarmediacenter.weebly.com to access digital books.
CES students can access digital books via the Quick Links tab/Destiny Portal on the CES website ces.coosaschools.k12.al.us.

div.h3: Click the link down below to download a copy of the drop off locations

div.p: DROP-OFF LOCATIONS/TIMES each Monday/Thursday beginning April 6, 2020 thru May 21, 2020.Â Please park considerately and in an orderly fashion.Â Leave room for the bus to park.Â REMAIN IN YOUR VEHICLE.Â Â Food/packets will be delivered to your car.Â IF YOU OR ANYONE IN YOUR HOUSEHOLD HAS EXPERIENCED SYMPTOMS OF COVID-19, PLEASE SEND SOMEONE FROM ANOTHER HOUSEHOLD TO PICK UP FOR YOU.
